843314224:
[

Project Manager - Pipe Jack

Company Name John Holland Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 91 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


From humble beginnings almost 70 years ago, John Holland has been driving positive change in Australia, and is now one of the nation’s leading infrastructure and property companies.

We work in Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia offering services from infrastructure and property development, to rail and building.

By finding solutions to complex challenges, we transform communities to make them easier to move around, more connected and better to live in.

We are currently looking to hire a Project Manager for a major pipe jack project we are delivering in Melbourne.

Responsibilities of the role include;

  • Management of overall delivery of the project, on or ahead of time with all client expectations met
  • Assign resources to deliver the works within budget, time, quality and regulatory standards, monitoring progress to ensuring project KPI’s are achieved and lead indicators applied.
  • Provide strong contractual, commercial and risk management, ensuring accurate forecasting and management of Cost to Date and
  • Lead engineering activities to ensure project are implemented in accordance with plans, designs and specifications
  • Develop and maintain positive relationships with all stakeholders, actively engaging and ensuring beneficial relationships between John Holland, the client, subcontractors and community.\xa0
  • Lead and motivate all employees (Staff and Workforce) to create a high-performing, safe and productive environment.
  • Ensure safety, environmental & quality management outcomes are in line with regional & corporate objectives and industry best practice
  • Finalise a successful handover satisfying all contractual, stakeholder and John Holland requirements.\xa0

To be successful in this key role, you must have;

  • Bachelor of Engineering, Construction Management or similar.
  • 2+ years’ experience as a Project Manager within a top tier Main Contractor or specialist pipe jack/HDD contractor.
  • Proven experience of developing and leading high-performing, multidisciplinary teams and budgets with project values of $25m+ and self-performed works
  • Full appreciation of the importance of excellent client relationship and stakeholder management with an ability to communicate effectively using influence and negotiating skills to drive positive outcomes.
  • Comprehensive knowledge of contractual, legal, commercial, industrial relations and legislative compliance
  • Geotechnical and underground experience including specialist pipe jack/HDD experience including site establishment, piling and shaft sinking

John Holland is up for the challenge of transforming lives.

From Parliament House to the Alice to Darwin Rail Link, from the MCG’s Great Southern Stand to Sydney Metro, we’ve had a hand in the Australia we all know today. We are currently involved in delivering many of Australia’s largest infrastructure projects. Whatever we face, the heart of what we do is creating people-centred solutions to complex challenges and opportunities. We think deeply about what we do and how it affects communities. We push boundaries and innovate, gain trust through our actions and whatever the project, we’re in it for the long, long term.

We work hard to attract and retain the best employees, and we provide opportunities for rich career experiences, and a strong framework for on-going career development.

We are committed to building, valuing and promoting diversity and inclusiveness across John Holland.

\xa0

Desired Skills and Experience

As above

Luke Jones

Group Manager Resourcing at John Holland

Job description

About The Role

Your Responsibilities

Due to a creation of a new role we are currently recruiting for a Technology Manager. This role will partner with key functions within the Australia & New Zealand pharma business to develop and execute a technology plan to support our business strategy . Reporting into the ANZ Technology Director this role will see you actively influence the business strategy by providing a range of technology solutions and opportunities that will provide value and help deliver enhanced business outcomes. You will partner with key business leaders to prioritize and implement technology initiatives that enable the businesses to achieve their goals and build strategic relationships with critical technology partners.

As a highly experienced Technology Manager of exceptional quality you can operate autonomously and deal with complexity when required, whilst business partnering with functional lead teams to build multi year strategic IT investment roadmaps.
Some of the key responsibilities of the role include
  • Act as primary IT point of contact for key Business Division/Units
  • Regularly partners with senior staff and management up to VP Level to develop multi-year plans that are enabled through technology investments or exploiting core strategic platforms
  • Accountable for technology selection and solution definition by working with local and global technical resources
  • Write and obtain approval for business cases for technology projects that will impact several hundred users
  • Accountable for the successful delivery of projects including ensuring projects meet time, quality and cost targets and ensuring that business benefits are realized from technology investments
  • Driving effective change plans to ensure that we maximize the value of all technology investments
  • Partners with Global Technology Support & Delivery organizations
  • Accountable to the business unit for the overall satisfaction with IT services and capabilities.
  • Responsible for external and internal technology scans and influencing the business cases for innovative technology solutions to drive business objectives (Innovation)
About You

Your strong IT business partnering skills, ability to work to tight timeframes and self-starter attitude will ensure your success in this role. In addition, we are looking for the following
  • Expertise in Business Analysis, Relationship Management and project delivery
  • Excellent leadership skills working in line and matrix roles; strong interpersonal skills, including networking and teamwork abilities
  • Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills
  • Outstanding customer service skills
  • Significant level of business consulting experience
  • Experience within a large complex organisation is desired but not essential
  • Experience using Sales Force, Veeva, Adobe Marketing, Qlik, Power BI and Teradata would be advantageous.
In return, we can offer you a rewarding culture that values you, focuses on your career progression, and makes you an integral part of our success.

If you’re looking to make a difference and enjoy a #careerwithpurpose then please click on the link below.

At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.

Why You?
IT Business partnering


IT Qualification PMP/Project Management

Why GSK?
GlaxoSmithKline is a global research-based pharmaceutical and healthcare company. GSK is bound by a global promise to keep patients’ interests at the heart of everything we do. We are committed to driving innovation and best practice in the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries, leading with ethical approaches to all our activities, access to medicines and reinvestment into the communities we operate in.

Contact information
You may apply for this position online by selecting the Apply now button.

Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. Company Name Datasource Services Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 85 views

Job description

Datasource Services has extensive, international experience placing skilled candidates within Business Intelligence, Data Warehouse and Data Science. Our network spans across Australia and New Zealand with a wide range of clients ranging from tier ones to start-ups. \xa0People and Data are at the heart of everything we do! Join the Datasource community today at www.datasourceservices.com.au

This is a brand new, Melbourne based, permanent opportunity to join one of Australia's leading independent IT Consulting firms. This role sits in their growing SAP Practice and focuses primarily around SAP HANA and BW integration.

The role:


  • Engage with stakeholders to understand business requirements on enterprise SAP integration projects.
  • Review and document all Business Analysis findings, assessing best approach for technical delivery.
  • Technical development and integration of multiple source systems into an layered SAP HANA & BW environment.
  • Integration of structured and unstructured data sets, using big data solutions such as Apache Spark for data streaming into SAP HANA.
  • Ongoing management of project deliverable's and stakeholder expectations.
  • Continuous development and integration on BW & HANA platforms.
  • Maintenance and upgrades of SAP HANA and BW environments as per business requirements.
  • Ad-hoc development of ETL solutions using Data Services (BODS) and BI Reporting using Business Objects (BOBJ).

  • Ability to understand architectural differences and intricacies around enterprise HANA & BW environments.

  • Any knowledge around Big Data platforms such as Apache Hadoop, Spark or KAFKA are desirable but nit essential.
  • Excellent problem solving skills with an analytical mindset.
  • Outstanding written and verbal communication skills are paramount.

This is a full time, permanent position based in the heart of Melbourne CBD. You will work alongside some of Melbourne's leading SAP Consultants and also have the opportunity to train and cross skill into other data driven and analytic platforms such as Hadoop, Tableau, Qlik, Informatica etc. Excellent company culture and clear career progression available. Job description

Newly created position within a family run business!

A portfolio of recognised and reputable brands in the baby industry

Including, a world renowned category leader in the child safety and stroller market!


Boasting some of Australia's most recognised baby brands, The Amazing Baby Company has been in a major player in the Australian Baby Industry for more than ten years.


We have a fantastic opportunity for a creative and experienced Marketing All-Rounder to join our diverse company with a great culture. You will be empowered to make key decisions that will mould the future of our brands and make a true impact on the market.


Working closely with the Managing Director and General Manager, you will devise brand strategies, execute go –to-market plans for new products and shape brand positioning through the use of social media, advertising and product seeding, to ultimately create sales opportunities for six leading brands.


With the support of a Marketing Coordinator and a Social Media Assistant you will be required to manage the overall brand message that is conveyed to the consumer through all digital platforms.


The ideal candidate will be an excellent communicator, fun and hardworking with the ability to roll up your sleeves and execute a well thought out plan. You will have the ability to manage a portfolio of brands and possess a creative edge that will bring fresh, bold ideas to the table.


Although it is not essential to have previous industry knowledge, you will show a willingness to immerse yourself in the products in order to gain an in-depth understanding of the range, the customer and most importantly the end consumer.


This is a busy and varied role providing support to the customer service and sales team and ensuring the effective delivery and production of a range of marketing initiatives.

\xa0

Key responsibilities will include:


  • Brand planning across 6 category leading brands
  • Campaign execution across print, digital, POS, events and PR
  • Managing and overseeing the digital strategy across all brands, including social media (Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn), websites, and SEO
  • Tracking, monitoring and evaluating digital campaigns to ensure optimisation
  • Liaising with and unearthing brand advocates and bloggers including product seeding
  • Creating sales opportunities through promotional campaigns, advertising and new marketing ideas
  • Working in conjunction with the head office of each brand to ensure that brand guidelines are fulfilled accordingly
  • Planning and executing strategic go-to-market plans for new products
  • Implementing and working within a pre-determined marketing budget for all brands
  • Filing and maintaining the company's digital library
  • Briefing brand communications for videography and photography
  • Developing strategic marketing plans to bring new consumers to the brands
  • Project Managing the development, enhancements and updates to company websites
  • Building and maintaining excellent working relationships with internal and external stakeholders (retailers, publishing houses and digital agencies)
  • Assisting in the planning and marketing for industry expos and events


In addition to this you will possess the following:


  • A Marketing Degree or Diploma
  • Minimum 5 years proven experience in a similar role
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • High attention to detail with the ability to prioritise and multi-task
  • Ability to work well independently as well as within a team
  • Enthusiasm, drive and an eagerness to learn
  • Proven experience in a similar role in consumer goods
  • A strong understanding of all digital and social platforms
  • Researching skills for trend analysis and creative inspiration
  • A high level of initiative
  • Experience using WordPress and Campaign Monitor (highly regarded)


We are looking for someone who is hands on with a bright and positive can do attitude. You will have the ability to make decisions and breathe new life into existing brands, whilst also inspiring exciting campaigns for new brands and products.


No red tape. No corporate.


Eastern Suburbs. Onsite parking. Impressive new office space. Friendly, casual but hard working environment with an exceptional culture.

\xa0

The successful candidate will be offered an immediate start.

[

Business Data Analyst

Company Name WorkSafe Victoria Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 375 views

Job description

  • $101,649 per annum + 9.5% super
  • Permanent Full Time Opportunity
  • New State of the Art Offices in Geelong
An exciting opportunity for a Business Data Analyst to join this newly formed team working across WorkSafe’s 2030 strategy to drive improvement across the business.

At WorkSafe our passion for the wellbeing of Victorian workers brings us together. Our people come from a wide range of professions and with no two days ever being the same, diverse thinking comes naturally to us. As we build the WorkSafe of the future we’re committed to delivering industry best practice to our people, our customers and the community.

About the role

The Business Data Analyst is responsible for delivering high quality analysis that provides business owners with the insights and recommendations that they need to drive improvement at Worksafe. You will also assist in the identification, capture and management of enterprise data to facilitate reporting, monitoring and analysis.

Responsibilities for this role include but are not limited to:
  • Participating in agile, cross functional teams to deliver analytic insights that drive the performance of our business.
  • Analysing and managing data including curation, feature development and assisting in identifying new data sources
  • Ensure data integrity and quality prior to submission to stakeholders
  • Effectively communicating complex analyses and findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical audiences
  • Engaging with Business SME’s to understand the business context, analytic requirements, and to develop creative, interactive, insightful reports and visualisations, including dashboards
  • Analysing large and complex data sources using appropriate tools and techniques to provide insights

Please ensure you take a look at the Position Description provided for additional information on accountabilities and experience required for this role.

Skills & experience
  • Tertiary qualification in a relevant discipline (Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Actuarial or other technical field)
  • A strong knowledge of and experience using data visualisation tools in day to day work (e.g. SAS VA, QlikView, Tableau)
  • Working knowledge of data science principles: predictive analytics, statistics (e.g. hypothesis testing, regressions etc.)
  • Experience with analytic programming languages such as SAS, R, Python
  • Demonstrated ability to liaise in a professional manner with a range of internal and external clients/stakeholders
  • Highly developed written and oral communication skills
  • Excellent time management, prioritisation and organisational skills, with the ability to meet tight deadlines
  • Hands on experience in managing large quantum of data in Big Data environment (e.g. Hadoop platform) an advantage

Benefits & culture

We pride ourselves on being a great place to work and offer flexibility to facilitate work/life balance. People who are seeking part-time or job share arrangements are encouraged to apply.

In return we offer a range of great benefits, including work variety, workplace flexibility and leave options, learning and development opportunities, study support, a leading health and wellbeing program, contribution to gym memberships and prescription eye wear and discounted corporate health insurance rates. WorkSafe prides itself on being a great place to work.

No applications from recruitment agencies will be accepted.

Only people with the right to work in Australia may apply for this position. You may be required to undergo a National Police Check (and Medical Assessment) as part of the recruitment process.

Applications close midnight 16 September 2018. Click the link to apply, and join us in making a difference to Victorian lives. Please note, candidate screening may take place prior to the closing of this advertisement.

For further enquiries please contact Keiran Jones on 03 9641 1040.

WorkSafe are striving to build a diverse workforce that reflects the Victorian community we serve.

Job description

  • Accelerate life-changing breakthroughs to cure, prevent & treat Type 1 Diabetes
  • Drive a significant increase in funding from philanthropy and major gifts
  • Senior hands on leadership role, interstate travel

\xa0

The Organisation

JDRF Australia is part of a global movement with representation in over 20 countries and has a clear and simple mission, to rid the world of Type 1 Diabetes (T1D) and to make each day better than the one before for people living with T1D.

\xa0

JDRF has a bold fundraising growth plan in place. You will be instrumental in growing their income from fundraising efforts by 2021.

\xa0

JDRF’s five values are passion, integrity, vision, impact and collaboration. JDRF reflect these values in a positive work environment that benefits the organisation as well as employees.

\xa0


Benefits & Culture


• Passionate and collaborative team culture
• Commitment to training and development
• Diverse recognition framework
• Generous salary packaging provisions
• Additional end of year leave

\xa0


The Role

With accountability for the delivery of targeted significant growth funding, you will manage your own portfolio and lead the philanthropy team, with responsibility for managing existing relationships and identifying new prospects. Specifically you will:

\xa0

• Manage your own portfolio and solicit gifts from major donors, trusts and foundations
• Ensure your team deliver on individual targets and metrics
• Work collaboratively with global counterparts and local leadership
• Prepare and submit high quality funding proposals
• Develop effective soliciting and stewarding programs which map to the donor journey
• Be accountable for the delivery of prospect opportunities including researching, wealth screening, donor profile development and actions

\xa0


Skills Required


This role is suited to a seasoned relationship fundraiser with the ability to think laterally and identify opportunities. You will have significant success in growing an organisation’s philanthropic profile and revenue with experience using communications and brand to maximise exposure.

Ideally you are in a similar role in either a NFP, the arts or agency, however, people with relevant commercial sales experience will also be considered. Additionally you will:

\xa0

• Be adept at identifying opportunities, plus developing and maintaining philanthropic relationships
• Have proven ability to articulate vision, mission and progress through effective storytelling
• Exhibit strong people management skills with proven ability to increase performance outcomes
• Demonstrate strong financial acumen

\xa0

Compliance checking will include Police Clearance and Working with Children (WWCC).

\xa0


If you are passionate about improving the lives of people living with T1D and in playing a lead role in creating a world without T1D, please click apply submitting your resume and cover letter addressing the skills required in MS Word format quoting #34501. 843910150:
[

Sales Engineer - ANZ

Company Name Zscaler Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

Born and built 100% in the cloud, Zscaler operates a massive, global cloud security architecture, delivering the entire gateway security stack as a service. By providing fast, secure connections between users and applications, regardless of device, location, or network, Zscaler is transforming enterprise security for the modern cloud era.

Pre-Sales Engineer

As a Zscaler Pre-Sales Systems Engineer, you and your Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for helping clients transform their network and application access by presenting the Zscaler cloud security solution to prospective customers, creating and delivering demonstrations of the products, gathering customer technical requirements, creating evaluation test plans with customers, and then managing the evaluation process to a successful conclusion.

To accomplish this, the solution consultant must have a strong desire to set the vision translating business objectives into enticing and actionable recommendations. The solution consultant will act as a trusted advisor to our clients while aiding the customer's transformational journey.

What We Expect You To Do

Within 30 Days
  • You will be expected to get hands on knowledge and experience with the Zscaler cloud platform
  • You will be expected to deliver a crisp Zscaler demo
  • You will be expected to familiarise yourself with Zscaler’s products and messaging and understand how we do things
  • You will connect with your peers throughout your region and the rest of the Zscaler organisation to learn and share experience
Within 60 Days
  • You will be expected to have mastered Zscaler’s messaging and competently present our proposition to your team
  • You will be educating customers on Zscaler’s technologies and competitive differentiators
  • You will be Proactively distributing new product information to our Partners and peer members within your assigned territory or region
  • You will be assisting Sales in the identification, qualification, design and sizing of opportunities against Zscaler’s prospect criteria
  • You will be assisting Sales in building and executing Account Plans
  • You will be configuring Zscaler features to meet customers’ requirements during the sales process
Within 90 Days
  • You will be Providing technical thought leadership and advice to enterprise customers on how to transform their digital experience leveraging Zscaler architecture
  • You will take total ownership of the technical sale and processes
  • You will be independently identifying and qualifying technical opportunities
  • You will be Developing and maintaining trusted advisor relationships with key customer stakeholders
  • You will be Independently delivering sales pitches, technical and whiteboards presentations,
  • You will be Utilising both internal and external resources to ensure successful deployments, that enable the customer to be self-sufficient following the sale
  • You will have Built effective relationships with Partners, the Customer’s technology group and Zscaler staff (products, services, marketing and support)
  • You will be Sharing best practices and developments in Zscaler methodologies both internally and at Partner and Customer events

What We Expect From You
  • BSCS or equivalent with extensive experience as an SE or systems integrator
  • Excellent knowledge and prior experience selling network security technologies including but not limited to: HTTP and web related technologies, proxies, caches, firewalls, SSL/IPsec, VPN’s, DLP, anti-virus, spam and spyware solutions (Gateway and SaaS)
  • Demonstrable experience with systems installation, configuration and administration of routers/switches, UNIX/Linux and Windows-based systems (prior Active Directory/LDAP experience desirable)
  • Practical experience working with routing and switching products, including troubleshooting;
  • You will have worked with Channel partners and you will have a solid understanding of a channel centric go to market approach.
  • A familiarity with SaaS based technologies and their implication.
  • Strong problem-solving skills, ability to analyse complex multivariate problems and use a systematic approach to gain quick resolution, often under duress
  • 'Whatever it takes' attitude and motivation to do whatever necessary to assist in closing a deal
  • You must demonstrate different influencing styles as appropriate to a situation, whilst demonstrating a history of successfully building and maintaining trusting relationships with associates and customers
  • You must demonstrate the effective transfer of thoughts and expresses ideas using speech and listening skills to influences others and gain support
  • You will be persistent, despite obstacles, opposition or setbacks and you will consistently convey a sense of urgency and drive issues to closure
  • Participate in the continuous improvement of Zscaler’s products and strategies
  • Likes to be the first to know something and to understand why and how things happen
  • Develop and deliver innovative custom solutions, including solution concepts to key decision makers to address their business issues and needs showing business value.
  • Operate independently in the opportunity for more than 75% of the time
  • Think beyond traditional measures of value ($) and incorporate risk, time, quality and other KPIs in the value proposition
  • Support Marketing with evangelism activities
  • Able to travel and work effectively throughout the assigned territory

What You Can Expect From Us
  • An environment where you will be learning cutting edge technologies and architectures
  • A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
  • Competitive salary and benefits, including equity
  • The pace and excitement of working for a Silicon Valley Unicorn
Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ : ZS ) is available at http://www.zscaler.com.
Zscaler is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job description

Our Company

At Ricoh, we understand that being first to market also means being first in quality, reliability and performance. This is what makes us a leader in our industry. We do this by working with our clients to create innovative, unique and tailored environmentally friendly sustainable solutions and services that truly deliver business efficiencies and simplify the life and work of our customers. We are dedicated to environmental management, and our strong community focus and culture of volunteering to society are an integral way of life at Ricoh. We could not enjoy our success without our passionate and committed employees and we want you to join us as we strive for continued excellence in all that we do.


Roles & Responsibilities
  • Accountable for managing the overall project delivery of client implementation projects and risk remediation of varying size, complexity, concurrency and criticality.
  • You will monitor and manage overall project profitability and project financial objectives that include, and are not limited to, managing resource requirements, project scope and schedule requirements; management of project budgets and reviews; managing timesheets, scheduling expenditures; analysing variances and ensuring variation outcomes are documented, costed, and approved.
  • You will prepare Strategic project plans and conduct regular strategic project status reviews.
  • You are required to track all billable work hours in the PMO time recording system and are responsible for ensuring this activity is completed by the end of every week
  • You are responsible for ensuring you promote best practice Project Management Services and promote Ricoh’s PMO value proposition through your personal actions, high performance and governance plans.
  • You will ensure the key status and performance of your projects are clearly and regularly communicated to all stakeholders.
  • Put in place appropriate indicators to provide a view of the health of a project for escalation, or re-prioritisation purposes.
  • Deliver engaging, informative, well-organized presentations to internal and external customers.
  • You will mentor and lead project teams and stakeholders in aspects of the profession such as job or project role expectations, leadership, methodology, tools and people skills.
  • Assist in conducting training and development that would benefit the successful planning, execution, delivery and support of projects and their products or services.
  • Mentor and lead project team members in aspects of the profession such as job expectations, leadership, methodology, tools, people skills and navigating politics.
  • Assist in conducting training and development that would benefit the successful planning, execution, delivery and support of projects and their products or services. This may include assisting or qualifying project management training vendors and monitor their delivery and effectiveness.
  • Assess, plan and execute Organisational Change Management and communication strategies


Candidate Criteria

As a suitable candidate, you will have:

  • 5 years minimum experience as a customer facing Project Manager.
  • Successfully managed and implemented a number of customer facing Infrastructure and/or Digital Automation Projects using project management methodologies, processes, systems and tools into large, enterprise organisations.
  • Referenceable experience in working within multi-disciplined teams, conducting formal and informal meetings, workshops and interviews to drive outcomes
  • Highly effective communication skills able to influence and motivate all internal customers (staff) and clients at all levels within the business
  • Must be willing to travel as required to meet with customers and Ricoh teams to build relationships and appreciation or design integrity
  • Strong ability to understand and articulate the objectives of various projects to different audiences in the correct context given the different project profiles within the business
  • Excellent documentation and presentation skills
  • Must be highly literate, numerate and have an agile mind for managing abstract concepts
  • Strong aptitude to be customer focused and commercially aware
  • Consistently deliver high-quality services to our customers
  • Professional Project Management Accreditation -PRINCE2, PMP or similar


Benefits To You

  • Access to LinkedIn Learning for all our employees
  • Discounts for Bupa's corporate memberships
  • Reward and Recognition Programs

  • 12-month fixed term contract in our Finance Team!

What you’ll be doing

The Finance Business Partner is responsible for supporting their divisional Finance Managers in delivering all aspects of Financial Control and FP&A for the business stream or function that they are leading. The Business Partner will work closely with both the Finance Manager and the key stakeholders in the division that they are supporting to deliver an end-to-end finance service.     • Reviewing and (processing if required) journals required in creating financial records
  • Financial Planning and Forecasting – working with and supporting the finance manager:
    • Prepare monthly and quarterly updates of forecast

  • Monthly/quarterly reporting of performance – working with and supporting the finance manager:
    • Monthly reporting to GM’s and relevant managers (comprehensive set of metrics including performance vs. prior year, prior month, budget and forecast as well as incorporating operational and performance data)

  • Business partnering – right hand financial partner to GM’s and Head of department:
    • Contact point for GM’s department heads

  • Qualified or part qualified accountant with a minimum of 5 years experience
  • Experience in delivering month-end process to produce timely results
  • Understanding of key financial processes required to run a business
  • Knowledge of financial processes and controls
  • Ability to apply key accounting standards
  • Understanding of budget and forecast process and ability to build a budget/forecast \xa0
  • Ability to analyse situations and connect the dots between financial, commercial and strategic goals \xa0
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Instinctive curiosity to look behind numbers and ask “why are we doing this?”
  • A natural desire to get out from behind the desk and interact with and learn about the business
  • Systems thinking – interest in implementing systems and processed to increase speed and accuracy


Our ideal candidate has a can-do attitude and gets a kick out of making things run more effectively. You have great interpersonal skills and you can work effectively with a diverse group of people who enjoy being part of a passionate team culture. Previous experience in a high-growth business is a plus.


What we offer

  • A fantastic culture of creatively minded, hard-working people who are passionate about Envato and being part of its growth and success
  • Flexible working conditions – we want you to love your work but also your life outside of Envato
  • We actively work on creating a safe, inclusive environment free from discrimination
  • A fast-paced and progressive environment where everyone has regular interaction with teammates and Envato community members from all over the world!
  • Read more from our staff about why they love working at Envato by visiting www.jobadvisor.com.au/envato


Who should apply?

We care deeply about diversity and inclusion at Envato, and welcome applicants of all types, and from all backgrounds. If you think you have the skills and experience needed for this role then we'd like to hear from you.

\xa0

What next?

Submit a cover letter and an up to date copy of your resume. Good luck!

Class Actions Litigation Technology Consultant

Company Name Slater and Gordon Lawyers Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 21 hours ago Number of views 8 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Class Actions Litigation Technology Consultant

The opportunity and role

As a Class Actions Litigation Technology Consultant you will be the technology consultant for our Class Actions Practice (the practice). This is a part time position that spans over four days a week.

Your role will liaise with internal and external stakeholders and you can expect to be the conduit between the practice and relevant project managers including Internal IT, project management, courts and e-discovery providers.

Drawing on existing practices in the sector and analysing the specific needs of individual cases, you will provide technical litigation-support assistance and identify and implement technology process improvements for, the practice.

In addition you will undertake the administration and development of technical systems, including conducting technical data analysis, training, data collection and establishing discovery and document reviews.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include
  • Manage administration of class action and e-discovery databases
  • Provide advice and assistance to the practice
  • Conducting new group member data-collection and entry exercises
  • Design and implementation of information systems and processes
  • Test and research improvement to existing processes
  • Design and implement measures to quantify cost savings and process improvements
Please note: A full position description is available on request.

To be successful

You will have a tertiary qualification in software engineering, system administration (or similar) and ideally you will be experienced in a similar role.

Your familiarity with Ringtail, scripting languages and broad understanding of statistical and data analysis will ensure your ongoing success in this position.

In addition your resume will display your extensive experiences in project management and front end data bases ideally within a Class Actions team or similar legal practice.

About Us

Slater and Gordon is a leading consumer law firm, our aim is to guide our clients to a brighter outcome by being passionate advocates of their best interests and champions of every client's cause.

We pride ourselves on offering easier access to world class legal services to clients from all backgrounds and socio-economic circumstances.

We offer our employees a genuine opportunity for career development in a supportive work environment.

Slater and Gordon value high performance. We recognise the contribution of our employees and reward them with a dedicated range of attractive benefits.

If you are interested in this opportunity please apply directly to Slater and Gordon. We prefer to liaise with you personally and are not accepting applications from recruitment agencies.

Job description



  • Part Time - 0.7 FTE
  • 2 Positions Available
  • Band 5 - approx. $67k(ft) per annum plus super


Cardinia Shire Council is looking for two enthusiastic, energetic and creative people to develop and deliver innovative arts and cultural projects and services for our rapidly growing community. With new arts facilities and programs currently in development, this position gives you the opportunity to help shape the creative future of this unique shire.

You will have specialist knowledge and skills in either live music, visual art (including digital/new media), public art or artist residencies and creative industry incubators, as well as having experience in delivering a range of arts projects concurrently. You will be a person who loves working in and with communities to plan live arts events, installations and activations, and also possesses outstanding organisational and administrative skills to enable you to deliver these projects to their full potential. You will also have great communication and interpersonal skills as you will be working closely with other arts practitioners and council staff to take Cardinia Shire’s arts program to the next level.

With beautiful natural landscapes, unique country towns, 150 nationalities, brand new arts facilities currently being built and a Council recently listed as one of Australia and New Zealand’s most innovative companies (AFR, 2018) Cardinia Shire is a dynamic and rewarding place to work. Cardinia Shire Council also offers an innovative health and wellbeing program, flexible working arrangements, unique leadership development and a significant reward & recognition program.

Follow this link to view the complete position description. Applications close Monday 17 Sep 2018.

To apply please complete the online application form. You will be required to upload your resume and cover letter, and respond to the key selection criteria on the form provided.

Enquiries to James Fischer on (03) 5943 4538.

All successful applicants will be required to undertake a National Police Check, pre-employment medical and obtain or hold a valid Working With Children Check.

Cardinia Shire Council is an Equal Opportunity and Child Safe employer who supports inclusiveness and diversity. 842504524:
[

Business Development Manager - Westpac Bank, Melbourne

Company Name Westpac Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 101 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



Westpac Group has a rich heritage and offers employees a multitude of opportunities. We aim to attract the best people inside and outside of the business – building an organisation where the best talent thrives. As we enter into our third century of business, we are cementing ourselves as one of the leading financial services company in Australia. We’re turning banking upside down by building strong teams at a local level, led by Managers who are close to their customers and empowered to make decisions that make sense for people in the communities they serve.

The Role

Reporting to the State Manager Home Lending, the Business Development Manager is a key business generation specialist driving First Party Home Lending through the Referrer Channel. He/She is accountable for generating new Referral Partners and for managing and growing a portfolio of existing referral partners. He/She will be providing coaching and supporting Mobile Home Finance Managers, Lending Area Managers, Relationship Directors and Relationship Managers across the Westpac Retail & Premium Network.

The Business Development Manager will be regarded as a retail banking expert in their assigned market and will be known as a trusted advisor to new and existing referral partners. This is a mobile role; therefore the Business Development Manager will have the ability to manage across multiple markets and stakeholders.

Accountabilities

  • Leading the preparation and execution of a referrer business development and sales plan for an assigned market/s
  • Proactively seeking new external opportunities and developing key business referral relationships in the local market
  • Manage and grow a portfolio of existing referral partners
  • Proactive acquisition of customers through working closely with Mobile Home Finance Managers, referral partners and self-initiated business development activities to identify new customer opportunities
  • Developing strong relationships with existing and new referrers, through the provision of superior customer service
  • Present as required at training days, networking and information evenings
  • Responsible for managing risk and compliance for the designated portfolio of referrers
  • Be an active member of the assigned regions enabling identification and building of relationships with retail customers, business influencers and referral partners
  • Partnering with Lending Area Managers and Relationship Directors to understand opportunity areas and insights from local communities
  • Work closely with Mobile Home Finance Managers and branch teams who will fulfil the customers’ needs

    • The person

  • Proven track record in generating new business in a defined business development role
  • 3-5 years of business development experience in the financial sector
  • Exceptional presentation, communication and networking skills
  • Demonstrated ability to engage with B2B partnerships using their value perspective to resolve issues, manage conflict or create opportunities
  • Proven track record in delivering results and meeting customer needs and expectations
  • Demonstrated capability to develop relationships and partnerships
  • Healthy ambition, self-confidence and a strong desire to personally invest in the high performance team culture within Westpac Retail & Premium
  • Sales and Service Practices
  • Coaching skills
  • Superior organisational skills
  • Analysing and interpreting
  • Attention to detail
  • Adapting and responding to change
  • Strong presentation and communication skills
  • Networking skills
  • Influencing and negotiation skills
  • Business acumen and market knowledge

    • Westpac Group is an equal opportunity employer. As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We have market leading employee benefits and financial product discounts. We also wholeheartedly support inclusion in the workplace and believe that work is something that you do and not somewhere you go to.
